summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to Verizon Wireless, commanding the production of subscriber and billing records for a specific cellular telephone number (505) 660-6192 from 2004-2006. It includes a non-disclosure notice and a certification form for Verizon to complete, indicating it is part of an ongoing federal criminal investigation.

persons.name: Christina Frederes
persons.context: Addressed as the custodian of records for Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless at the Olathe, KS address in the subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands the custodian of records to appear and testify before the Grand Jury, or alternatively to provide the requested records to the FBI by this date.

events.title: Early Voluntary Turnover Deadline
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office requests an early voluntary turnover of the subpoenaed materials by this date.

locations: 500 Australian Ave., Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
701 Clematis Street, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401
505 South Flagler Drive, Ste. 500, West Palm Beach, Florida 33401.5823
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena (FGJ 08-1103(NDB)) was issued for all subscriber and detailed billing records for cellular telephone number (505) 660-6192 from January 1, 2004, to December 31, 2006.
The subpoena includes a strict non-disclosure notice, warning the recipient not to disclose the existence of the request or their compliance, as it could obstruct a federal criminal investigation.
The document reveals an active federal grand jury investigation in the Southern District of Florida as of March/April 2010, with the FBI involved in collecting evidence.
The requested phone number is identified as belonging to Cellco Partnership d/b/a Verizon Wireless, with the official custodian of records located in Bedminster, NJ.
The document transmission chain shows the subpoena was faxed by the U.S. Attorney's Office on March 29, 2010, and the response/rerouting from Verizon Legal Compliance occurred on April 2, 2010.
